name: One Serve Game
focus: Relationship between kills and hitting errors
description: Compete and keep track of kills and errors.  Team that wins point gets next ball.  Go for time (5 - 8 - 10 m)
scoring: +1 for a kill, -2 for a hitting error
behaviors: Good set/bad set decision, swing to score, coverage saves errors
notesVariations: Have losing team do a special activity after each round. Be careful of the punishment. The competition should be high paced and intense, additional intensity will tire players out quickly.  Compete for 2 minutes instead of three minutes.  Change how ball is entered (outside hitter offense/ defense, mean ball)
keywords: Competition, Free Ball Offense, Free Ball Defense
stepByStep: 1. Enter ball with a free or down ball. 2. Team that wins gets a point and the next ball. 3. Continue for three minutes. 4. Team with the most points at the end of the three minutes wins. 5. If there is a tie, play a tie breaker point.

name: 1 or 1/3
focus: Side out offense / 1st ball kill
description: Get one point for a 1st ball kill or 1/3 for a sideout.  Rotate on whole points.  First team to rotate all the way around wins.  Play reverse side out (if you win point you receive)
scoring: 1 point for 1st ball kill, 1/3 a point for side out.
notesVariations: Decide how you want to handle missed serves. At lower levels you may want the server to serve again, or have a coach ready to serve if there is a miss to keep the drill moving. At higher levels you may want to count a missed serve as a first ball kill.  Focus on keeping the pace between points quick, have balls ready for servers
keywords: Side Out Game, Serve Receive Offense
stepByStep: 1. Sides alternate serving and receiving. 2. Play out points off of the serve. 3. If receiving teams side outs with a first ball kill (as defined by you) then that team rotates. 4. If receiving team wins point (but not with a first ball kill) then they get 1/3 a point. Once they get three points they can rotate. 5. The team that rotates all the way around first wins.

name: 1st Ball Setting Skills
focus: Work on varying offense in game situations
description: Two teams competing with teams getting 2 points if they can use the first contact as a set to a hitter for the second contact.
scoring: 1 point for regular points, 2 points for scoring off 1st contact set and attack
behaviors: Call offense early, identify situations and opoortunitites
notesVariations: Changing how the ball is entered makes it harder to do 1st ball sets. Free balls would be easiest, then down balls, the off speed attacks then serves would be the hardest.  Encourage players to be creative and aggressive. If they feel like the ball coming over the net is easy, turn it into a 1st ball set option.  Award points (+1) for every attempt at a 1st ball set, regardless of whether then win point or not, to encourage the behavior.  How does this effect the hitters? What will they need to do to be ready for this type of set
stepByStep: 1. Enter ball with a free or down ball. 2. Play out rally, team that wins rally gets a point. 3. If a team can use the 1st contact as a set and score then they get a bonus point (+2). 4. Winning side gets next free ball or down ball. 5. Repeat for a set amount of time or goal of points

name: 2 v 2 Zones
focus: Defending and attacking situations with the setter in each of the 4 zones.
description: Teams compete with 1st ball being initiated into 1 of 2 predetermined zones.
notesVariations: Both teams use the same zones (keep it even).  Both teams use different zones (to increase or decrease difficulty)  Alternate balls entered to the 2 zones for each team.  Randomly enter balls to one of the 2 zones.
stepByStep: 1. Determine the zones the teams will be using. 2. Coach enters ball into 1 of the 2 zones for each team signifying the first contact. 3. Teams play out rally, winner gets a point. 4. Coach enters ball to other team into 1 of the 2 zones for each team. 5. Repeat for set amount of time or goal of points.

name: 3 out of 5 Rotation Game
focus: Competing within individual rotations.
description: Two teams compete in one rotation to 3 points.  Team that wins rotation gets a big point.
notesVariations: Teams do not have to win by 2 points, or they must win by 2 points.  If a team can win a mini game 3-0 they get a big point.  Teams start in the same rotations, or start in different rotations (to create different match ups)
stepByStep: 1. Teams compete in mini games to 3 points. 2. Teams stay in the same rotation for each mini game. 3. Team that wins mini game gets a big point. 4. Both teams rotate. 5. Team that won big point gets to choose to serve or receive to start the next mini game. 6. Repeat for a set number of rotations, a set amount of time or goal of points

name: 3-2-1 Points Per Contact
focus: Competing to generate creativity in offense.
description: Two teams compete.  Scoring is based on # of contacts.  If teams score on 1 contact they get 3 points, 2 contacts 2 points, 3 contacts 1 point.
behaviors: Find space, think outside box, turn easy into swings
notesVariations: 1. Two teams compete. 2. Points for rallies are scored based on the number of contacts that are used. 1 contact = 3 points, 2 contacts = 2 points, 3 contacts = 1 point. 3. Play for goal of points or for time.
stepByStep: Start off a serve. Service aces are 3 points, and service errors are 3 points for other team.  Start off free or down ball.  Hitting errors can be 1 or 3 points for the other team. Use 3 points to discourage teams from making hitting errors. Use 1 point when you want teams to focus on scoring their own points.  Blocks would be 3 points for blocking team (1 contact)  Overpass kills would be 3 points (1 contact)

name: 5 Zone Offense / Defense
focus: Defending and attacking situations with the setter in each of the 5 zones.
description: Teams compete with alternating balls.  Starting in Zone 1.  If team wins the ball from that Zone they move to the next Zone when it is their turn.  1st team to win every zone wins.  Must win the offensive ball to win the zone.
notesVariations: Teams go in order from 1 to 5 or from 5 to 1.  Teams must win the defensive ball (ball is entered to other team) to move to the next zone.
stepByStep: 1. Starting with Zone 1 a ball is entered for each team. 2. If team wins their offensive ball they can move to the next zone. If they do not then stay in that zone until they do. 3. 1st team to win an offensive ball in all 5 Zones wins

name: 4 out of 5 Free Balls
focus: Free Ball Offense
description: Teams receive free balls 5 at time.  If a team can win 4 out of 5 of the free balls they get a point/
behaviors: Freeze, isolate, swing to score
notesVariations: Play sudden death version where the team that gets 4 out of 5 first wins. (can have an option of allowing the other team an opportunity if they have not had a chance)  Receiving team must pass free ball perfectly or they lose point. (increase difficulty)  If a receiving team loses 2 free balls then stop and switch to the other team without completing the set of 5.
keywords: 6v6, Free Ball Offense, Free Ball Defense
stepByStep: 1. Coach will enter 5 free balls to one side. 2. Team receiving free balls must with 4 out of 5 of the balls to score a point. If they do not then no points are awarded. 3. Coach will enter 5 free balls to the other side. 4. Repeat for a set number of sets, for a set number of points or for time.

name: 5 and 1
focus: Compete with an emphasis on free ball scoring.
description: Teams compete in a mini game to 5 points off serve.  Team that gets to 5 first is given a free ball, if they score off the free ball then they get a big point.
notesVariations: Stay in one rotate for the 5 point games. Rotating or switching rotations after each 5 point games.  Team receiving free ball must score off the first swing.  Team winning 5 points must defend a free ball to score a big point.
keywords: Competition, Free Ball Offense, Free Ball Defense
stepByStep: 1. Two teams compete off a serve to 5 points. 2. Team that wins gets a free ball. 3. If team wins the free ball point they get a big point. 4. Repeat for time or set number of big points

name: 7 Up
focus: Competing off serve
description: Two teams competing off a serve.  Teams get 2 points for a 1st ball kill, 1 point for side out or serve point.  If receiving teams has a zero pass their team score goes to 0.  Play to 7 for big points.
notesVariations: Instead of a zero pass points are flushed on a reception error.  Flush points on missed serves.  Flush points on missed 1st serves into the net.  Give two points if a receiving team scores on first ball attack.
keywords: Competition, Serve, Serve Receive, Side Out Offense
stepByStep: 1. Two teams compete off a serve to 7 points. 2. If a receiving team has a zero pass (as defined by your system) then that team loses all their points and goes back to zero. 3. When a team gets to 7 then give that team a big point and repeat. 4. Repeat for a set number of mini games to 7, or for however mini games you can get into set amount of time.

name: 15 Kills
focus: Working together to get kills
description: Can only score points of kills.  Must get to 15 to win.
behaviors: Swing to score, Find matchups
notesVariations: Change how balls are started to increase difficulty, free ball, down ball, outside hitter offense/defense, off a serve (winning team receives, winning team serves)  Encourage team to develop a game plan and strategize how they will generate kills.  Switch positions by rotating or by switching front row and back row. This can be done after a set amount of time (1-2 m) or a set number of kills (1-3).
stepByStep: 1. Start off a free ball. 2. Teams play out points. 3. Team that wins point gets next ball. 4. Continue until a team gets 15 kills

name: 15 B4 6
focus: Score points / minimize errors
description: Teams have to get 15 kills before they commit 6 errors to win.
notesVariations: Players must learn to balance aggressiveness to generate kills and good decision making to limit hitting errors.  Go over ways to eliminate or reduce hitting errors (like hitter coverage).  Can be done out off a serve (will slow game down and require more time).
stepByStep: 1. Enter ball off a free or down ball. 2. Teams play out point. If a point ends in either a kill or a hitting error than those will be recorded. 3. Team that wins point gets the next ball. 4. A team must get to 15 kills before committing 6 hitting error in order to win the game. 5. If a team gets 6 hitting errors they lose.

name: 3 Minute Games
focus: Competition in a short time frame
description: Teams compete in 6 on 6 for short amount of time.
notesVariations: Have losing team do a special activity after each round. Be careful of the punishment. The competition should be high paced and intense, additional intensity will tire players out quickly.  Compete for 2 minutes instead of three minutes.  Change how ball is entered (outside hitter offense/ defense, mean ball)
keywords: Competition, Free Ball Offense, Free Ball Defense
stepByStep: 1. Enter ball with a free or down ball. 2. Team that wins gets a point and the next ball. 3. Continue for three minutes. 4. Team with the most points at the end of the three minutes wins. 5. If there is a tie, play a tie breaker point.

name: Around the World Serving Competition
focus: Work on targeted serving in competitive situations .
description: Two teams competing off a serve.  Each server serves 6 times, 1 to each zone.  Rotate after the 6 serves.  Teams get 1 point for winning a rally and 1 point for serving to the correct zone.
scoring: Points for rally, points for hitting zone
behaviors: Line up to serve, hold finish

name: Automatic
focus: Work on serving tough
description: Teams compete off a serve.  If receving team starts with a 3 pass they automatically win the point.
behaviors: Serve to space, serve flat, serve clean
notesVariations: Specifically define what a 3 pass is so everyone knows and there is no debate.  Each server is only allowed one serve or limit the number of serves they can have (1, 2 or 3)  If receiving team makes a 3 pass and scores off their first attack give them a bonus point
keywords: Side Out Game, Serve Receive Offense , Serving, Serve Receive
stepByStep: 1. Teams compete off a serve. 2. If receiving team makes a 3 pass (perfect pass) they score a point, stop play with setter catching ball. 3. If pass is not a 3 pass play out rally with a point awarded for who wins. 4. Team that wins point serves the next ball. 5. Repeat for set amount of time or point goal.

name: Back Row 1st Ball Off Dig
focus: Work on attacking and defending back row attacks in transition
description: Two teams competing.  Coach hits ball to a back row player.  Team must dig and set a back row attack off the first attack.
scoring: Points, 2 points for kill off 1st back row attack
behaviors: Dig high, load to attack, lead hitter

name: Baseball
focus: Free Ball / Down Ball Offense
description: One team receives free balls.  If they win point they score a 'run', if they lose they get an 'out', after 3 outs then other team gets free balls.
notesVariations: Switch players or rotate every inning.  If you need to make it harder for one side then increase the number outs they need to end the inning (4 or 5)
keywords: Free Ball Offense, Free Ball Defense
stepByStep: 1. Team that is up first receives free balls. 2. If they win a point they get a run, if they lose the point then they get an out. 3. After three outs the other team is up. 4. Repeat for a set number of innings

name: Bandit
focus: Recover from difficult defense plays
description: Coach hits down ball on the side of the defensive team.  Defender can only play the ball with one arm.  Play out points.  Team that wins point gets next ball
behaviors: Full extension, dig up, call out setter
notesVariations: Coach can hit to the setter if they are defending. Team must use their out of system offense if setter does dig the ball.  Give defender multiple attempts to get a playable ball off one arm.  Coach has control of the difficulty of the down ball.  Only give points if digging team wins or give bonus points if digging team can score off their first attack.
stepByStep: 1. Coach hits down ball to one of the defenders. 2. Defender must dig ball with only one arm attempting to control it as much as possible. 3. Play out ball with winning team receiving a point. 4. Repeat for a goal of points or for time

name: Best Ro v Worst Ro
focus: Compete in difficult match ups.
description: Two teams compete staying in the same rotation for the entire game.  Set up so one team (non starters) are in a 'good rotation' and the other team is in a 'bad rotation.'
notesVariations: Can be done off free ball for less time (5-8 minutes)  Work on 2 hitter vs. 3 hitter rotations.  Put ‘starters’ at a disadvantage by making them stay in their worst rotation.  Work on rotations with weak servers vs. strong servers.  The point is to put one team at a disadvantage so that they have to overcome in order to win. It is supposed to be hard or ‘unfair.’  Do two rotations for 5 minutes each.
stepByStep: 1. Both teams are set up in one rotation. Teams will stay in that rotation for the entire game. 2. When teams side out they do not rotate. 3. Play for a goal of points or for a set amount of time

name: Bingo
focus: Competition and goals
description: Each team is given a combination of 5 things they must do to score a BINGO. (5 kills, 3 kills from middle 2 from outside, 4 kills and 1 block)

name: Big Bounce / Little Bounce
focus: Recover from difficult defense plays
description: Coach hits ball down into the ground so the ball bounces high or low.  Teams must recover and play out point.  Team gets two more contacts after bounced ball to get it over net.
behaviors: Settle, go high, find a swing
notesVariations: Only give 1 contact after bounce to get ball over.  Team that wins point gets another ball, or team that wins point gets to defend 1st.  Control difficulty with bounce, try and simulate different situations (bounce into net, bounce off the court)
stepByStep: 1. Two teams compete off bounced ball from Coach. 2. Coach can bounce ball low or high. Coach controls difficulty with bounce. 3. Team that receives bounce has two contacts to get ball over net (the bounce simulates the 1st contact). 4. Repeat for a set number of points, goal of points or for time

name: Breakfast
focus: Starting from an emergency situation
description: Teams compete where first contact must be a pancake.
notesVariations: Players are generally not great at actually executing a pancake that generates a playable ball. Be prepared to give multiple balls to get a playable ball.  Allow two contacts after the pancake.
stepByStep: 1. Coach tosses ball to start play. 2. Player must pancake the tossed ball. 3. The team has one more contact to get ball over the net. 4. Play out rally. 5. Team that wins rally gets the next pancake ball. 6. Repeat for time or point goal.

name: Bumpers
focus: Work on bump setting in competition
description: Two teams compete with setters only allowed to bump set.
notesVariations: Teams get a bonus point if middle gets a kill off the bump set. (to encourage creativity and taking a risk)  Want to show setters how much harder it is (usually) to run an offense with the bump set to discourage them from doing it more in games.  Discuss with the setter how you want the offense to be run off a bump set (options include the height of set, focus on easy sets, and switching the court)
stepByStep: 1. Coach starts with either a free ball or down ball. 2. Teams compete against each other. 3. Setters are only allowed to bump set. 4. Play for a goal of points or set amount of time

name: Chaos 1-2-3
focus: Work on chaos situtations
description: Two teams competing.  Coach enters ball and calls out 1, 2 or 3.  The number called is the number of contacts that the team has to get ball over.
notesVariations: Coach controls difficulty with number of contacts the team has and location of ball entered.  Coach can enter ball with a toss, a chip, a down ball, a serve, The randomness of how the ball is entered adds to the chaos aspect of the drill.  Give a bonus point if the team can score off their first attack
stepByStep: 1. Two teams compete off ball entered from Coach. 2. Coach calls out “1” “2” or “3” to team receiving ball signaling how many contacts the team has to get the ball over the net. 3. Play out rally, team that wins rally gets a point. 4. Repeat for a goal of point, set number of points, or for time.

name: Chart and Adjust
focus: Work on using information to make adjustments during competition.
description: Two teams competing.  Chart attackers (1, 2 or all).  Play for a set amount of time to generate data.  Take a break, use chart to determine adjustments.  Continue playing with adjustments.
scoring: Points (Total) / % Points won before and after

name: Chop Ball
focus: Work on chopping ball based on call.
description: Two teams compete, attackers must chop ball (hit side of ball) based on call from their teammate.
behaviors: Thumb down, thumb up, attack the side

name: Chutes and Ladders
focus: Score points for kills / lose points for hitting errors.
description: Use cards to determine value of points (+ for kills / - for hitting errors).  If team gets a kill they get the points, if they get a hitting error the lose the points.  Winning point without a kill or HE means you get next ball but no points.
behaviors: Recognize bad situations, be aggressive

name: Connect 4
focus: Defending and attacking situations with the setter in each of the first 4 zones.
description: Teams compete with balls entered into Zone 1-4.  Teams must score in each zone to score a big point.
notesVariations: Start in free ball, serve receive or transition.  Allow team receiving ball to chose the Zone the ball will be entered into.
stepByStep: 1. Coach enters ball from end line starting with Zone 1. 2. Teams play out rally. 3. Team that wins rally gets a point for Zone 1. 4. Coach enters ball from end line to team the won rally to Zone 2. 5. Repeat until a team wins a point in each Zone (1-4). 6. Team that scores a point in each zone gets a big point. 7. Repeat for set amount of time or until a set number of big points.

name: Dig-Trans Serve
focus: Work on scoring in transition and then going immediately to serve.
description: Enter a ball hit to a defender.  If defending team scores in transition then the attacker that serves go back to serve.  Team must win served point to score a big point.
notesVariations: Coach can control difficulty with the attack.  Have defending team start in defensive positions.  Have defending team start in base and release from base to defensive position when ball is bounces by coach.  Use the person who got the kill as the server to change the server and the rotations.
stepByStep: 1. Coach hits ball to a defender. 2. Defender digs ball. 3. Defending team transitions and attacks. 4. If defending team scores in transitions then the hitter that got the kill goes back to serve. 5. Teams get a point for scoring in transition and can earn another point off the serve. 6. If defending team does not serve then hit ball to the other team to restart. 7. Repeat for a goal of points, set number of points or for time

name: Double-Double-Double
focus: Attacking and defending in double block situations.
description: Two teams compete.  Team gives 3 free balls to offensive team.  One for outside, one for middle and one for right side.  Defending teams sets double block against each hitter.
behaviors: Set block, hip to hip, thumbs up
notesVariations: Change the order of the free balls.  Have blockers set and ready to block hitter before free ball is given.  Teams can set the hitters in any order and defending team must work to set double blocks.  If a team scores or defends all three balls give them a bonus point.  Have hitters run different attacks with the defending team knowing what sets they are using.  The goal is to make the attackers work against a solid well formed double block
keywords: Competition, Blocking, Attacking a Double Block
stepByStep: 1. Coach enters three free balls to attacking team. 2. Team must set the outside on the first ball, middle on second ball and right side on third ball. 3. Defending team sets a double block against the initial attack. 4. Give three free balls ot the other team. 5. Repeat for set number of rounds, goal of points, or for time

name: Dunkin Donuts
focus: Work on attacking with a setter and defending setter attacks.
description: Two teams competing in mini games to 7 points.  If setter can score off a setter attack then the other team goes back to zero points for that mini game.
scoring: Big points for mini game to 7 wins
behaviors: See the set, disciplined base, hips under ball
notesVariations: Mini games are to 5 instead of 7.  Play games off serve, or down ball / free ball.  Stay in the rotations where the setter is front row, or make setters play in back row as well.  Limit the types of attacks the setter can use.
stepByStep: 1. Teams compete in mini games to 7 points. 2. If a setter can score off an attack then their opponent’s score goes to 0 points. 3. When a team gets to 7 points they get 1 big point. 4. Repeat for set number of mini games, for time or for a goal of points.

name: Ultimate Queens of the Court
focus: Defend your court
description: 3 teams play for a set number of balls or play.
behaviors: 2 o 3, 3 o 5 for big points.
notesVariations: Play 3 out of 5 points.  Keep the pace fast. We do not want the team that is off the court waiting for too long.  Alternate who gets the down ball, but the first ball always goes to the winning side to give them an advantage.  Give all the down balls to the attacking side. This will make points harder to get.
keywords: Competition, Free Ball Offense, Free Ball Defense
stepByStep: 1. Enter ball with a down ball to winning side. 2. Team that wins gets a point. 3. Down ball goes to winning side. 4. Team with 2 out of 3 points wins. 5. If winning side wins they stay and get a big point. If they lose they rotate off and other team takes their place. 6. Team 3 joins court and they start over. 7. Repeat for a set amount of time or until a team reach point goal.

name: Error Game (Need a better name)
focus: Minimizing errors
description: Points are banked until a hitting error is made the team that does not error can collect all their points.  Then both teams start over.
notesVariations: Start off a serve (include service and reception errors as 2 point plays).  Give 2 points for hitting errors only.  Coaches will need to officiate if points are given for blocking errors (net touches) or ball handling errors (lifts or double contacts).  Keep track of points and note how many points were scored off errors. Are you giving away to many points with your errors? Are you relying on your opponent to error to score your points?
stepByStep: 1. Enter ball with a free or down ball. 2. Team that wins gets a rally gets the next ball. 3. If rally is ended on an error (hitting, blocking, ball handling) then the other team scores 2 points. 4. Repeat for set number of points or for time.

name: First Contact Game
focus: Pressure on Free Balls / First Contacts
description: Two teams competing against each other.  If the first ball entered must be a 'perfect' pass or the other team scores a point.  If it is not a perfect pass the point is stopped and awarded to the other team.  Team that wins point receives the next ball.
behaviors: Freeze, Eyes
notesVariations: Define what a ‘perfect’ pass is for your team. We allow the setter to take one step out of target.  The object is to generate higher levels of pressure on the first contact to make players focus on executing proper technique.  Use this drill as a warm up to 6 on 6 play to get players to focus on the first contact. Keep time short, 5 - 8 minutes, it puts a lot of pressure on players.  Players do not like to be the cause of losing points. If pass is not perfect blow whistle and award point, there is no need for additional feedback, unless it is positive. Players need to learn to move on.  Players must use overhead pass on first contact.  Do not award point for first contact that is not perfect, stop play and give ball to the other team. The first contact is a gate to allow play to continue.
keywords: Side Out Game, Serve Receive Offense
stepByStep: 1. Coach enters free or down ball to receiving team. 2. Team must pass the ball ‘perfectly’ to continue play. 3. If pass is not perfect the defending team scores a point. 4. If pass is perfect play out the rally awarding point to teams that wins. 5. Repeat for time or to point goa

name: First Play Game
focus: Running combination plays / Defending combination plays
description: Two teams compete where the first play is dictated by the Coach.  The teams must run that combination or they lose the point automatically.
notesVariations: This can be an offensive and/or a defensive drill. If the focus in on defense reward team that wins with the ability to defend first.  Run multiple plays that change depending on the time in the drill. For example, first 3 minutes are 1-X-5, next 3 minutes are 4-Z-5.  Award a bonus point for scoring or defending the first play (defensive team wins in transition off first attack).
stepByStep: 1. Coach enters ball. 2. Team receiving first ball must run a pre-defined combination play with their hitters. 3. If receiving team can not run play, or does not run play they lose point. 4. Play out rally, team that wins rally gets a point and the next ball.

name: Family Fued
focus: Competing / Winning Points
description: Start with a joust, winning team has to score 7 points before defending team scores 3.  If defending team stops them they have a chance to steal.  Steal by winning point off their serve.
scoring: 7 before 3 with a chance to steal
notesVariations: Rotate players for jousting or keep them in the middle at the beginning of each round.  Flip front row and back row players after each round (use substitutes for front row or back row only players)  For younger or lower level teams, change the stealing points component to they must win a point while receiving a serve
stepByStep: 1. Choose two players to joust to start the round. Usually it is players across the net from each other. 2. Team that wins the point off of the joust receives the free balls. 3. The team receiving free balls scores a point for every free ball point they win. 4. If the team receiving free balls loses the point they get a strike. The receiving team must get 7 points before the defending team gets 3 strikes. 5. After three strikes the defending team has an opportunity to steal the points. 6. In order to steal the defending team must serve and win that serving point.. 7. Repeat for time or for a certain number of points to determine a winner

name: Focus Games
focus: Focus on defined situations to start competition.
description: Start with a defined situation.  If team can not execute it they lose the point.  After first possession teams can play out rally.
behaviors: Vary depending on focus
stepByStep: 1. Enter ball with a free or down ball. 2. Teams play within the constraints of the specific activity. 3. If a team does not do prescribed action (hit line, run middle) as the activity requires they automatically lose point. 4. Repeat for set amount of time or goal of points is reached.

name: 1st Ball Back Row
focus: Work on attacking and defending back row attacks.
description: 1st attack off free or down ball must be a back row attack.

name: 1st Ball A - Set Over
focus: Work on running and defending an A with the Middle and a setter attack.
description: 1st attack must be an A (31) from the middle or a set over from the setter.

name: 1st Ball Slide
focus: Work on running and defending slides.
description: 1st attack must be a slide from the middle attacker

name: Middle / Setter Attack on 1st ball
focus: Work on running and defending middle attacks and setter attacks.

name: Off Blocker Def 1st Ball
focus: Work on attacking the off blocker and off blocker defense.
description: 1st attack must be from a pin attacker and they must make the off blocker play the ball

name: OH 3/4 Swing Line 1st Attack
focus: Work on attacking with a 3/4 swing down line from the Outside Hitter.
description: 1st ball must be a 3/4 swing down the line from the Outside Hitter.

name: Outside Hitter v 1 Pass Defense
focus: Work on attacking and defending out of system attacks from the Outside Hitter

name: Scramble Play
focus: Work on scramble plays (emergency)
description: Toss ball off court. Player must play the ball over the net on the first contact (simulating a broken or scramble play).

name: Tip on First Ball
focus: Work on attacking and defending tips.
description: 1st attack must be a tip..

name: Focus Games off Serve
focus: Focus on defined situation off a serve or the first posession.
description: Start with a defined situation.  If team can not execute it they lose the point.  After first possession teams can play out rally.
behaviors: Vary depending on focus

name: Middle 1st Ball
focus: Work on running the middle off serves.
description: Receiving team must run a middle off the serve.  If they can not they automatically lose the point.
behaviors: Freeze, be available
notesVariations: Continue play if receiving team can not run a middle attack off their first possession but award a point to serving team (serving team can win two points in one rally.  Middle attack in front of or behind the setter required.
stepByStep: 1. Start off a serve. 2. Receiving team must run a middle attack off their first possession or the serving team wins the point automatically. 3. If receiving team runs middle attack off their first possession continue play and award point to team that wins rally. 4. Repeat for goal of points or set amount of time or serves.

name: Serving Target
focus: Serving to specifc targets
description: Teams compete.  If server misses zone, or serving target then receving team automatically wins point.  If they hit target then play out points.
behaviors: Line up serve, palm to target
notesVariations: Each team only serves once per rotation.  If team hits zone they get a point, if they miss zone continue play.  If serving team hits zone they get to serve again, even if they lost rally.
stepByStep: 1. Call service zone or area for serving team. 2. Serving team must hit zone called or they lose the point automatically. 3. If serving team hits zone called then continue play and award point to team that wins rally. 4. Repeat for goal of points, set amount of time or serves

name: Serve 123 to score
focus: Work on short serve.
description: Serving team must execute 123 serve.  If serve does not make passer move forward receiving team automatically wins point.
behaviors: Stop hand on contact
notesVariations: Each team only serves once per rotation.  If team makes passer move forward they receive a point, team that wins rally receives a point.  Be specific about which passer the server must move forward.  If serving team hits makes passer move forward they get to serve again, even if they lost rally.
stepByStep: 1. Serving team must serve a ball that makes passers move forward to play ball or they lose the point automatically. 2. If serving team makes passer move forward then continue play and award point to team that wins rally. 3. Repeat for goal of points, set amount of time or serves

name: Serve 789 to score
focus: Work on deep serves.
description: Serving team must execute 789 serve.  If serve does not make passser move backward receving team automatically wins point.
behaviors: Drive hand through ball
notesVariations: Each team only serves once per rotation.  If team makes passer move backward they receive a point, team that wins rally receives a point.  Be specific about which passer the server must move backward.  If serving team hits makes passer move backward they get to serve again, even if they lost rally.
stepByStep: 1. Serving team must serve a ball that makes passers move backward to play ball (or overhead pass) or they lose the point automatically. 2. If serving team makes passer move backward then continue play and award point to team that wins rally. 3. Repeat for goal of points, set amount of time or serves

name: Fringe Zones
focus: Work on defending balls passed to areas on the fringes of zones.
description: Teams compete with balls entered into specific zone borders. (1-2, 1-3, 1-4)
notesVariations: Work on one specific border for the entire game.  Work on all borders zones for a set amount of time (2-3 minutes for each zone). Spending time to go over the differences of each zone before each.
stepByStep: 1. Coach enters ball from end line into the zone border area representing the 1st contact. 2. Play out rally. 3. Team that wins rally gets a point and the next ball. 4. Repeat for a point goal or for a set amount of time.

name: Game Over Games
focus: Work on playing under pressure.
description: Compete in short games where predetermined plays result in automatic losses for teams (missed serve, block for a point, reception error)
behaviors: Vary depending on focus
notesVariations: Set restrictions that will end mini game at the beginning of the drill or for each mini game.  Examples of restrictions could be: blocked for a point, service error, reception error, blocking error (net).  Restrictions could be set up to encourage behaviors. For example, giving up a kill to opponent's middle hitter to encourage teams to run middle attack.  No lead is safe, meeting restriction results in an immediately loss for that mini game
stepByStep: 1. Enter ball with a free, down ball or serve. 2. Team that wins gets a point and the next ball. 3. Continue for a goal of points for mini game (5 or 7) 4. If a team has a play that meets the restriction requirement that team will lose the mini game immediately, regardless of score. 5. Repeat for set amount of mini games, for time or goal of big points.

name: Game Point Game
focus: Work on playing in a game point situation.
description: Teams competing with one team at 'game point'.
behaviors: Swing to score, cover, who is attacking
notesVariations: Use different ways to enter ball (free ball, outside hitter transition, out of system, off court toss, serve or serve receive)  Working on developing a game point mentality and being aggressive, to go for and take advantage of opportunities.  Do one type of situation, do multiple in a row.  1 team does all the scenarios, other team just has to stop them to win.  Consequence can just be losing the game, or it could be a minor physical activity.  Do activity for time, working in bunches of opportunities.  Do multiple times over a practice, at set times, or as a transition between drills or breaks.
stepByStep: 1. Designate team that has game point. 2. Enter ball (use different ways depending on goal). 3. Team at game point must win point or they get a consequence

name: Go To
focus: Work on players being the focus of the offense.
description: Teams of 6 competing.  Assign a player as the 'go to' player for each rotation.  Each hitter should have 2 rotations.  The 'go to' hitter must get a set amount of kills for the team to rotate.  Team the rotates all the way around 1st wins.
behaviors: Be available, transition, move around

name: Greed
focus: Competing / Winning Points
description: Both teams start with a number of balls, the teams that wins gets to keep the ball.  Most balls win.
notesVariations: Play mini games within each rotation. Stay in one rotation for the entire mini game (7, 11, 15 points) The team with the most total balls at the end of the game wins (play 6 rotations or pick a few to work on)  Start with empty carts on each end line the team to put their balls in when they win. Give each serving team a new ball to start the point.
stepByStep: 1. Two teams competing off a serve with normal rotations. 2. Team that wins point gets to put the ball form the point in their ball cart. 3. The team with the most balls at the end wins. 4. Play for a set number of serves (15, 21, 25)

name: Gumbo
focus: Work on different aspects of scoring
description: Teams compete in a series of mini games, scoring a big point for each mini game win.   Mini games total to 25 points.  1st game is to 9 points, 2nd to 7 points, 3rd to 5 points, 4th to 3 points, 5th to 1 point.
scoring: Win in a mini game = 1 point
behaviors: Vary depending on focus
notesVariations: Mini-games combine for 25 total points.  Try and use faster games for more points player. For example play the 9 point game off free balls.  Examples of different games: Free balls Down balls OH defense transition Mean balls Joust Rally scoring (off a serve) Zone Balls (passes to a Zone) Wash scoring (2 free balls must win both to score) Side out scoring (must win serve point to score)
keywords: Competition, Free Ball Offense, Free Ball Defense
stepByStep: 1. Compete in a 9 point game. 2. Compete in a 7 point game. 3. Compete in a 5 point game. 4. Compete in a 3 point game. 5. Compete in a 1 point game. 6. Teams score 1 big point for each mini-game win.

name: Hand Set / Bump Set Wash
focus: Work on different techniques of setting in a competition setting
description: Teams compete by getting two balls in a row.  One ball setter can use their hands to set the second the setter can only bump set.
scoring: Win both balls to get a point
notesVariations: Coach can designate which ball is for hand setting and which is for bump setting.  Bump setting can be limited to receiving side, or both teams.  Bump setting is limited to just the first possession or the entire point
stepByStep: 1. One side receives two balls in a row. 2. Play out each point. 3. In one ball the setter can use their hands to set. In the other ball the setter must bump set. 4. Team receiving balls must win both in order to score a big point. 5. After two balls switch who receives the balls. 6. Repeat for a goal of points or for time.

name: High Set Offense
focus: Work on attacking and defending higher sets.
description: Teams compete with attacker hitting 2nd tempo or higher sets. (Middles can not hit quick attacks)
behaviors: Set with space, wait wait

name: Hit the Pin Game
focus: Attacking outside hitter in serve
description: Teams compete while attempting to serve outside hitter in serve receive.
scoring: +1 for making outside hitter pass serve, can only score if they do.
behaviors: Line up serve, Finish to target

name: Joust-Down Ball-Down Ball
focus: Compete on offense and on defense
description: Start with a joust play, winning team gets first down ball, if they win again the other team gets a down ball.  Must win all three to score.
behaviors: Feel the hands and swipe

name: Kill the Free Balls
focus: Free ball offense and defense
description: Team gets free balls, if they rally they get a point and another ball.  If they lose the point the other team gets the next ball.
behaviors: Nail the free ball pass, call loud, swing to score

name: Kriss Kross
focus: Work on running and defending crossing patterns.
description: Two teams compete off free or down ball.  The 1st attack must have a crossing pattern.
scoring: Points, Bonus points for scoring off a crossing pattern

name: Level Up Serving
focus: Scoring off serve
description: 2 teams competing against each other off a serve.  Each team can only serve once per rotation.  Teams get 1 point for siding out.  The 2nd time around teams score 2 points if they win the serve point.  The 3rd time around teams score 3 points if they win the serve point.
scoring: 1 point for a side out, 1 point for a serve point the first time around, 2 points for the 2nd time around, 3 points for the 3rd time around.

name: The 400
focus: Side Out Offense / Scoring off Serve
description: Winning team gets to receive serve.  They rotate if they side out.  In order to win the team must rotate all the way around against one server.  Missed serves count as a side out.  If no one rotates all the way around in allotted time the team that rotates the furthest off one server wins.

name: Make a run
focus: Scoring points in a row off a serve
description: Points increase for every point after the first one scored by the serving team.
scoring: +1 for first point off serve / +2 for second / +3 ... etc

name: Make it Take It
focus: Side Out Offense / First Swing Side Out
description: Must get a kill to receive a serve, winning point gets you a free ball.  Must get a first swing side out to rotate (score)
scoring: First swing side out to rotate, rotate 6 times to win

name: Mean Ball Game
focus: Giving aggressive free balls to disrupt opponent's offense
description: Teams start by giving mean balls to oppoenent.  Team that wins point gets to give mean ball.
behaviors: Drive to corner, take setter out, find a seam

name: Mixed Defense vs.
focus: Compete with varied and mixed defenses.
description: Two teams compete.  Each team is given a set of defensive constraints that they must play.(for example: rotation vs. OH and perimeter vs. RS)
scoring: Points (lose point automatically if team plays wrong defense)

name: 6 v 6 Monarch of the Court
focus: Adapting and creating strategy.
description: Divide players randomly into 3 teams.  Team on winning side receives serve, if they win they stay and get a point.  If they lose serving team takes their place.  Off team moves to serving side.

name: Mulligans
focus: Creating a growth mindset, first swing side out
description: Two teams competing off serve.  If a team earns a first swing side out then that team gets a mulligan.  Mulligans can be used to redo plays or contacts.

name: Name that Tune
focus: Siding Out
description: Teams challenge each other with the number of serves they need to rotate all the way around
scoring: Side outs then rotate all the way around.

name: Net Play
focus: Work on playing the ball out of the net.
description: Two teams competing, first ball is played out of the net.  Teams can two contacts after ball goes into net to get it over.

name: No Bro Game
focus: Work on non liberos playing back row and serve receive.
description: Two teams competing with no bro (or DS's for Middles).  Liberos will serve but will not go on the court.  Each team serves one time.

name: No Free Balls
focus: Being offensive and generating attacks
description: Teams compete against each other.  If they have to give a free ball they lose the point.
behaviors: Get under ball, lift ball, find a swing

name: No Touchie
focus: Avoiding the libero, libero range
description: Teams get a point if the libero touches first ball.
behaviors: Be offensive

name: Nyah's Game
focus: Work on competing with pace.
description: Two teams compete off a serve.  Serving team serves 5 balls in  a row.  Serving team can run and serve as fast as they want.  After 5 serves other team serves 5 balls.
scoring: Points, 3 out 5 points for big point
behaviors: Control pace, get to receive quickly, reset and ready

name: Out of the Play Into the Play
focus: Practice getting back to base and taking advantage of players not in base.
description: A player from the defending side starts off the court in one of three designated spots.  The player must return to their base as quickly as possible.
behaviors: Get to base, find the space

name: One Handed Set Game
focus: Practice using one handed sets in competition
description: Two teams competing starting off a free or down ball.  1st set made by setter must be a one handed set.  Play out rally with points awarded for winning.
scoring: +2 for kill off one handed set, +1 for everything else
behaviors: Show two, give one, pass on net

name: Perfection
focus: Work on side out offense.
description: Teams must side out 6 times in a row (1 for each rotation) to win.  Team that gets the furthest wins if nobody gets 6.
scoring: Side outs , rotate all the way around to win

name: Poker
focus: Work on players developing strategy to achieve a team goal.
description: Teams work together to meet assigned goals.
scoring: Must meet 5 goals to complete their hand.
behaviors: Vary depending on goals of their hands.

name: Push 2
focus: Work on playing to two points to simulate end game situations
description: Teams compete to 2 points.  Can start off free ball, down ball or serve.  Team that loses must run a half suicide.
scoring: Points, win by 2. Big points for wins

name: Random Rotation Game
focus: Work on different rotations.
description: Teams randomly start in a rotation (die roll).  After each point roll die and change to rotation.

name: Random Serve Game
focus: Work on hand contacts and using different types of serves in competition.
description: Server is given a random serve (die roll, drawn) that they must execute to start play.
behaviors: Hand contact, see serve

name: Repeat
focus: Work on scoring under pressure.
description: When a player gets kill.  As soon as the ball lands a free ball comes over the net to the team wit the player that got a kill.  That play must score on that first attack in order to score a point.
behaviors: Big transition, see the defense, find the floor

name: Reverse Side Out Game
focus: Siding Out
description: If you win the point you receive the serve.

name: Rotation Wars
focus: Work on specific rotations and scenarios
description: Teams compete off a serve within specific rotations.

name: Run Down
focus: Work on recovery and taking advantage of bad situations.
description: Random player (designated by rotation number) must run to designated spot before returning to play when they contact the ball.
behaviors: Talk about space, take advantage

name: Running Set Over Free Ball
focus: Work on giving free balls from recovery situation and resetting base defense.
description: Team giving freee ball starts on end line (all 6).  Coach gives ball to free ball team, a player must run and overhead pass a ball over the net.  Giving team must reset to base defense.
scoring: Points, Bonus points for winning off free ball
behaviors: Hands up, find a seam, hands together

name: Serial Killer
focus: Develop go to players and mentality of a go to player.
description: When a player gets a kill they become the 'Serial Killer'.  They must get 3 kills before other team wins a point.  When the team gets a kill that team gets free ball until they are stopped.
behaviors: Be available, swing to score

name: Set the Bar
focus: Work on free ball offense and defense.
description: Two teams compete.  One team receives a free ball, if they win the point they get another free ball.  If they lose the point then give free ball to ther other team.  The team with the highest round wins.
scoring: Free ball points won in a row.
behaviors: Pin point pass, find a match up, get a touch

name: Side Out Game
focus: Side Out Offese / Scoring off Serve
description: 5 serves per rotation, alternating serving teams, scoring is based solely on siding out.
scoring: +1 for side out, +2 for first swing side out
behaviors: Freeze platform, find a match up, set big hitter

name: Side Out and Serve
focus: Side out and making first serve
description: 6 v 6 off serve, one serve per rotation.  If a team side outs they do not score that point until they make their serve.
scoring: Points, hold side out point until serve is made

name: Slide / Shoot Wash
focus: Work on attacking and defending different set options
description: Two teams of 6 competing.  Team receives two ball in a row.  The 1st attack must be a slide or a shoot (to OH), on the 2nd ball the team must run the other set on the 1st ball.
scoring: Win both balls to get a point

name: Star Zone Offense Defense
focus: Work on defending plays from specific setting zones.
description: Following the pattern of:  1-2-1-3-1-4-5-1 play out rallies with balls starting in those zones.

name: Step Close Anywhere
focus: Work on generating aggressive swings from awkward positions.
description: Coach tosses a ball in front of a player (can be any of the 6 on the court) that player must step close and attack.  Teams play out rally.
behaviors: See ball, step close to ball, focus on finish

name: Target Serving Game
focus: Work on serving to targets in a competitive situation.
description: Two teams of 6 competing off a serve.  Coach gives server a target.  Teams play out rallies.
scoring: +1 for hitting target with serve, +1 for winning rally (serving team)
behaviors: See path of ball, line up to target, focus on finish

name: Tennis
focus: Sideout Offense / Scoring off Serve
description: Play sets with tennis scoring with the same server (0-15-30-40-45)
scoring: Must win the set to score

name: Torero Drill
focus: Sideout Offemse, Serve Defense
description: Two teams competing starting at score of 9-9 to 15.  Serving team is in rotation where middle is serving.
behaviors: Serve to space, touch at net, big transition moves

name: Trifecta
focus: Combining different concepts into one activity
description: Play 3 different 6 v 6 games, each for 5 minutes only.
behaviors: Varies depending on the drills

name: Tug of War
focus: Creating runs of points.
description: Teams compete for points off free balls.  Winning points moves counter toward an overall win, losing moves it the other way.  Teams must reach goal to win a big point.

name: Two Pointer Defense
focus: Attacking and defending areas of the court.
description: Teams compete, if an attacker can score by hitting a set area of the court then their team scores 2 points.

name: Two Serve Game
focus: Work on serving different types of balls in competition.
description: Two teams competing off serve.  Server will serve two balls regardless of who wins point.  Server must attempt to execute two different serves.
behaviors: Line up to target, hand finish,visualize path of ball

name: Under the Fence 1st Swing Sideout
focus: Work on serving flat and first ball side out
description: Teams compete off serve.  Serving team must serve between top of net and top of antennae.  Receving team must side out on first ball.  Team that wins point serves.
scoring: 1 point for 1st swing side out, bonus point if serve is not flat
behaviors: Toss in front, swing to score, get a touch

name: USA Drill
focus: Sideout under pressure / Compete
description: Alternating free/down balls.  If a team wins 3 in a row they get to receive a serve. If they win that point they score.

name: Vs. Free Ball Defense
focus: Defending Free Balls
description: One side gets free balls for a set amount of time.  Defending team gets a point for ball they win.  Reverse directions for the same amount of time.
behaviors: Dive, pursue to the ground

name: Vegas
focus: Free Ball / Down Ball Offense
description: 3, 5, or 7 free/down balls.  Team that has the greater amount can choose serve or receive.  Must win that point to keep their free ball points.
scoring: Points for free balls, must earn points then get to 21 to win.

name: Wave Game
focus: Free Ball / Down Ball Offense
description: Start with 12 players on the court.  Extra player line up in 3 lines on one end line.  Give free balls to the side winning side.  If they win they get a point, if they lose then teams wave.
scoring: Points for winning points on winning side

name: W-I-N
focus: Building / Stopping Momentum
description: Must win 3 in a row (W-I-N) to get a big point
behaviors: Big first step off net, Dive, Pursue to ground

name: WIN (Off Serve)
focus: Point scoring
description: Two teams compete off a serve.  Serving team must win 3 points in a row off serve to score a big point.
scoring: 3 served points in a row = big point
behaviors: Serve to space, set good block, dig high

name: Will put the line up in wrong (again)
focus: Adapting / Finding a way
description: Line up is out of order and players must play and adapt to it.

name: Yahtzee
focus: Varying offense / scoring
description: Must get a set number of kills in each play set to score a big point.  Encourage divirsifying offense, once they close out a play set they can not score any more points with that set.
scoring: 3 or 5 kills to score big points

name: Yahtzee Deluxe
focus: Varying offense / scoring
description: Same as Yahtzee but can also get points for things like blocks, middle kills in transition, tooling the block (any additional behavior we want to encourage)
scoring: 3 or 5 kills or behaviors to score big points

name: Zone 2 Offense
focus: Work on offense for balls passed into Zone 2
description: Two teams of 6 competing.  Start from serve receive (any rotation).  Toss ball into zone 2.  Play out rally.
behaviors: Stay in front/behind, switch court

name: Zone Wars
focus: Defending and attacking situations with the setter in each of the 4 zones.  (or 5 zones)

name: Zone 5 - 1
focus: Work on generating offense for difficult passes.
description: Coach tosses 1st ball in from endline to represent a zone 5 pass.  If team wins that point then give them a free ball.  Can only score if they win free ball point.
scoring: Points for winning free ball points.

name: Zone Competitions Timed Games
focus: Work on offense and defense for different zones.
description: Starting with Zone 1, teams compete for a set amount of time (1 minute, 1.5 minutes, 2 minutes).  Repeat for each zone.
scoring: Big point for winning mini game within each Zone

name: Zone Mini Games
focus: Work on offense and defense for specific zones.
description: Two teams compete with ball initiation to one Zone for the entire game.  Play to set amount of points (11, 15, 21, 25)

name: Zone 5 x 5
focus: Work on Zone 5 offense and defense (OOS)
description: Two teams compete with a bll initiated into Zone 5.
scoring: First team to 5 points gets a big point.
behaviors: Get wide, see set, finish deep

name: 4 to 0
focus: Scoring in offense with increasing difficulty
description: 4 hitters (left, middle, right and a back row attacker) against a full defense.  Give free balls to attacking side.  Hitters must get a kill to get out of drill.  Attacking team is done when all hitters are out of drill.
behaviors: Approach to score, double arm lift, find a match up

name: Approach Around
focus: Awareness, attacking around other players
description: Two passers on 10' line with attacker in left passing position.  Serve balls to passer.  Attacker can attack either a 1/4/5 and should move around passers as appropriate.
behaviors: See pass, call for attack, get on step.

name: Arm Swing Bounce
focus: Arm Swing
description: Attacker stands about 3' from net.  Coaches tosses ball.  Attacker swings and bounces ball under net.
behaviors: Drive hand through ball, focus on finish

name: Arm Warm Ups
focus: Movements to warm up arm and work on armswing technique
description: Players execute specific movements and techniques to warm up and focus on specific arm swing techniues
behaviors: Various depending on technique and movement

name: Back Row Pass Retreat Attack
focus: Pass to attack for backrow
description: 3 back row hitter and a setter.  Players pass a free ball on or near 10' line.  After the pass they must retreat so they can approach to attack from back row.
behaviors: Pass first, get back to load up, lead the hitter

name: Bad Ball Competition
focus: Attacking out of system
description: 2 hitters v 6 defenders, hitters attack off toss in sets of 5 each competing against each other.
behaviors: See set, swing to score, finish to 5

name: Bomb the Endline
focus: Attacking deep
description: 4 defenders along the end line.  Hitter attempts to hit hard and deep to the defenders.
behaviors: Finish long, drive deep

name: Bucket ball
focus: Rollshot (offspeed) attacking
description: Outside hitter and right side hitter, toss ball to setter (can be off a free ball pass or even a controlled serve), set to hitter (alternating) attackers must approach and hit a roll shot into a ball cart.
behaviors: Finish high and hold high, put spin on ball

name: PSH
focus: Pass-set-hit chain with specific shots and location.
description: Players pass-set-attack with defined areas of attacking and types of attacks.
scoring: Execution of proper technique and location gives points
behaviors: Types of attacking and locations prescribe behaviors.  Finish, over the shoulder, tip up, face and finish.

name: Attacking Progression
description: Step close, Full Approach, Thumb Down, Thumb Up

name: Free Ball / Down Ball Trans PSH
focus: Transition from blocking to attacking
description: Attacker starts on net, free or down ball, attacker transitions off net then attacks.
behaviors: See ball come over, big first step off, see pass

name: Front / Back
focus: Attack in front and behind setter, step close range
description: Blocker tosses ball over, hitter passes ball and makes call for attack in front or behind the setter.
behaviors: Pass first, directional step, step close

name: PSH Lines
focus: Pass to attack
description: Blocker tosses ball over, hitter passes ball and makes call for attack.  Three lines for maximum repetitions.
behaviors: Pass first

name: Pass Set Swing Hit
focus: Attacking a range of sets, reading pass to dictate attack
description: Hitter start in middle of the court.  Receives a ball (free/down/serve).  Hitter must pass and then transition to attack.  Hitter can attack anywhere along the net.  Encourage hitter to move around.
behaviors: Pass first, read pass, call loud, directional step

name: Retreat Pass-Set-Hit
focus: Work on moving off the net to pass and attack
description: Hitter starts at net in blocking base.  Blocker from 10' line tosses ball over for hitter.  Hitter must retreat and pass ball to setter then attack.  Rotate through positions.
behaviors: Hands first, finish high, retreat to load

name: Cherry Picker
focus: Attacking against a blocker
description: Alternating attacks, players attempt to attack around block. Sets of 5 or 10.  Players must transition betweem each.
behaviors: Big first step off net.  Attack ball with block.  Finish away from hands.

name: Chop Left / Right
focus: Attacking using a chop attack (hitting side of ball)
description: Set up like hitting lines off a free ball pass. Passer calls for left or right when hitter jumps.  Hitter tries to hit the side of the ball called by passer.
behaviors: Thumb up, thumb down, over the shoulder

name: Cross Court Termination
focus: Terminating the ball cross court in transition
description: Alternating free/down balls.  Set to outside.  OH must terminate, if other team can dig and score cross court they score.  Define cross court area.
behaviors: Set off and in, swing to score, face the finish

name: Hit Against the Flow
focus: Attacking against flow of approach
description: Attackers approach at angles and hit against the angles.
behaviors: Thumb up, thumb down, over the shoulder

name: Hit and Recover and Recover
focus: Work on repeated attacking as if an attack was dug back over the net.
description: Initiated off a toss or down ball.  Pass to setter, setter sets one of the three hitters.  Before ball lands on attack tossers throws another ball over the net to simulate a dig over the net.  Repeat for set number of repetitions or goal of quality attacks.
behaviors: Cover, track down, big transition

name: Hit the Pin Pass to Attack
focus: Attacking from serve receive when pinned on side line.
description: Server tries to make outside hitter pass and attack out of serve receive when pushed close to side line.
behaviors: Line up to passer, error in, see serve, call early

name: Hitting Lines
focus: Develop timing, work on setting and hitting for multiple positions.
description: Setter sets hitters from all position groups.
behaviors: Be on step, hold finish, swing to score

name: Off Free Ball Variation
focus: Develop timing, work on setting and hitting for multiple positions off a free ball pass.
description: Off a free ball pass, setter sets hitters from all position groups.
behaviors: Eyes on platform, be on step, hold finish

name: Free Ball Transition Variation
focus: Work on attacking from a free ball transition move.
description: Hitters start at net.  Off a free ball, hitters transition and then attack off a set.
behaviors: Ready position, get past 10' line, directional step

name: Serve Receive Variation
focus: Work on attacking and setting from serve receive.
description: From a generic serve receive pattern players receive a serve and pass, set and attack.
behaviors: Read, eyes, call attack loud

name: Outside Defense Variation
focus: Wrok on attacking and setting from a defensive transtion.
description: Players set up in positions for defense against an outside hitter.  Ball is entered and players transition to attack.
behaviors: Dig high, big first step off, call loud

name: 2 Setter Trans Variation
focus: Work attacking and setting off a transition move for the setter.
description: Two setters switch transitioning to target and setting multiple attackers.
behaviors: Shoulder to net, square and set, call loud

name: Back row Option Variation
focus: Work on full offense setting and attacking with a back row option.
description: Three front row hitters and a back row attacker.  Setter runs multiple options.
behaviors: Lead the back row

name: w/ Blockers Variation
focus: Work on full offense against three blockers.
description: Three front row hitters and three blockers.  Setter sets hitters and they attack against the block.
scoring: +1 for quality attack, +1 for a block, +1 for a block touch
behaviors: Rest in base, see the set, make hard moves

name: w/ BR Defenders Variation
focus: Work on full offense against three back row defenders.
description: Three front row hitters and three back row defenders.  Setter sets hitters, they attack and defenders attempt to dig.
scoring: +1 for quality attack, +1 for a dig
behaviors: Ready, release, ready

name: w/ Floor Defender Variation
focus: Work on full offense against full floor defenders.
description: Three front row hitters and five defenders. Setter sets hitters, they attack and defenders attempt to dig.
scoring: +1 for quality attack, +1 for a dig
behaviors: Ready, release, ready

name: Back Row Attacking Variation
focus: Work on back row attacks from all zones.
description: Three back row attackers (no front row).  Setter sets back row players, they attack.
behaviors: Lead the back row, jump behind land in front

name: Hitting Pit Drill
focus: Attacking fitness
description: Down ball to passer (or attacker), pass to setter, set to attacker, next ball goes over net when attacker lands (or returns to blocking base), repeat for a set number of attacks or some sort of goal.
scoring: Defined goal (hit to an area X number of times)
behaviors: Big first step off net.  Get on step.

name: Hitting Pit Competition
focus: Attack fitness with some competition
description: On both sides of the net and alternating. With down balls going as soon as hitter lands (keep pace quick)
scoring: First to get ball in X zone Y times wins
behaviors: Big first step off net.  Get on step.

name: Inside Pass to Hit
focus: Attacking after making an inside passing move
description: Give outside hitter balls they must move in to pass then attack off set.
behaviors: Pass first, hard move (back or out)

name: In System / Out of System
focus: Attacking from an in system set and an out of system set.
description: Hitters attack in system and then out of system.
behaviors: Get on step, see the set

name: Two Hitter Variation
focus: Attacking from an in system set and an out of system set.
description: Multiple hitters attack in system and then out of system.

name: Three Hitter Variation
focus: Attacking from an in system set and an out of system set.
description: Multiple hitters attack in system and then out of system.

name: Pass In Swing Out w/ Middles
focus: Attacking off a short inside pass in the path of the Middle Hitter
description: Enter a ball short and in for pin attacker.  Pass and swing out to attack.  MIddle must get into approach or audible.
behaviors: Pass first, hips under ball, step back

name: Pass To Swing
focus: Passing to attack transition, timing step
description: Player gets a free ball in middle third of court, passes it to setter, transition out to get a full approach and swing.
behaviors: Pass first, weight on the pass, move to load, get on step

name: Pass to Swing - Switch Court
focus: Passing on one half of the court and attacking on another.
description: Hitter gets a free ball, if they pass on left side of court they must attack on right side, if they pass on right side they must attack on the left side.
behaviors: Pass first, read location, call early, get on step

name: Perimeter Attacking
focus: Attacking the perimieter of the court.
description: Tape lines inside the side lines.  Players attack and score if they hit inside the perimeter area.

name: Pin v 5
focus: Work on attacking from the pins against an overloaded defense
description: Starting off a down ball.  Pass, set and attack from right or left pin.
behaviors: Find a seam, swing to score, dig high

name: On the Ground Tooling
focus: Attacking off a blockers hand
description: With a partner, one is attacking one is blocking from standing position on the ground.  Attacker tosses ball and hits it off their partner's hand.
behaviors: Finish through hands out of bounds

name: Over the Net / Under the Net Warm Up
focus: Warming up arm while working on hand contact and different arm swings.
description: With a partner, one on each side of the net, players go through a series of throws and swings sending the ball over and under the net.
behaviors: Focus on finish

name: Rocker Step Approach
focus: Work on step close
description: Player starts with feet down on their step close, after toss, the attack does their step close in the same place and attacks.
behaviors: Step close, hips down, big arms

name: Running Transition
focus: Work on transition into an approach, generating speed in approach and changing force to net into force up
description: Attacker starts on net.  On cue player turns and runs to end line.  Tosser tosses when player is about half way back.  Attacker transtions from a run into an approach and attacks.
behaviors: Find the four step, hard brake step, big arms up

name: Self Toss and Chop
focus: Work on chop attack (attacking side of ball)
description: Hitter tosses ball.  Hitter approaches and jump.  Player behind them calls left or right.  Hitter chops ball based on call.
behaviors: Thumb up, thumb down, attack side

name: Self Toss and Hit
focus: Attacking without a setter, high rep
description: Player tosses a ball and hits it.  Start with back row attacks and then move up to on the net.
behaviors: High toss, Step close to ball, big arms, finish

name: Self Toss and Hit with Defender
focus: Attacking to a defender
description: Player tosses ball and hits it to defender on other side of the net.
behaviors: High toss, Step close to ball, big arms, finish to defender, dig high

name: Cross Court Variation
focus: Attacking to a defender
description: Player tosses ball and hits it to defender on other side of the net who is cross court.
behaviors: High toss, Step close to ball, big arms, finish to defender, dig high

name: Shots / Targeted Attacking
focus: Work on attacking different shots out of controlled serve receive.
description: Off a controlled serve a team of 6 pass-set and attacks to specific areas on the court.
behaviors: Vary depeding on attack, location

name: Short Serve Hitting Lines
focus: Attacking off short serves
description: Server serves short balls.  Players pass, set and attack.
behaviors: Hips low, platform out, match angle

name: Step Close Drill
focus: Working on the step close of the approach and adjusting within the last two steps.
description: Attacker starts with their first step made and inside the 10' (all of their weight on that foot).  Toss is made and attacker uses just their step close to attack the ball.
behaviors: Weight inside 10', step close to ball, big arms

name: Solo or Double
focus: Work on reading the number of blockers and adjusting attacking.
description: Attacker hits against a full defense.  Blockers randomly double or single block attacker.
behaviors: Take a look

name: Swing Defense Transition Attack
focus: Work on transition from swing defense position for left front to attacking
description: Attacker does half block move for double block on middle, upon landing moves to cover tip behind block.  If the tip goes to them then they must pass and find an approach (5 or 4) if the attack does not go to them they have to move to attack a 1.
behaviors: Land and move, see attack, dig high, find approach

name: Swing Around
focus: Work on transition move and timing for attack out of serve receive with a focus on getting outside the court.
description: Attacker starts in left side serve receive position.  Passer starts at left T.  Server gives short ball to passer.  Passer passes to setter.  Attack moves outside passer and transtions to attack.
behaviors: Shuffle move, get on step

name: Targeted Bomb the Endline
focus: Work on communication with hitter and attacking deep.
description: Attacker attempts to attack to one of four defenders.  Coverage player calls out defender for attacker to hit to.
behaviors: Hard approach, call on way up, finish to number

name: Three Swings - Attack and Dig
focus: Work on different arswing finishes
description: Attacker on box hits balls to three defenders using straight, thumb up and thumb down swings.
behaviors: Finish to defender, hold finish

name: Two Handed Bounce Under Net
focus: Work on the double arm lift and draw of armswing
description: Attacker starts a little more than arms length away from net.  Attacker tosses ball with two hands then swings at ball bouncing it under the net.
behaviors: Double arm lift, draw, big bounce

name: Two Hitter 10' Line Game
focus: Passing close to the net, setting, running slides and defending off speed attacks.
description: A competitive game inside the 10' line focusing on two hitter rotations.

name: Two Hitter Combos
focus: Work on combination plays with two hitters.
description: Two hitters work on combination plays where the player that does not pass runs a 1st tempo set and the player that passes runs a second tempo set.
behaviors: Call hard, be available, directional Step

name: Two Setter Hitting Lines
focus: Work on attacking with two setters for more repetitions.
description: Hitting lines using two setters at different spots.
behaviors: Call hard, be available, hold finish

name: Two Hitter Off a Free Ball Pass
focus: Work on attacking with two setters and a free ball passfor more repetitions.
description: Hitting lines using two setters at different spots and free ball passers.

name: On / Off Two Setter Variations
focus: Work on attacking with two setters from on and off the net.
description: Hitting lines using two setters at different spots.

name: Armswing 1-5 Progression
focus: Technical work for armswing breakdowns
description: Attacker does armswing motion using 5 key spots.

focus: Go through motion of the armswing accentuating key technical spots.
description: Attacker does armswing motion going from one point to the next with a distinct stop at each spot.
behaviors: Draw, palm open, elbow high, lead with hand, finish snapped

name: 1-5 Slow
focus: Hitting each individual spot on armswing
description: Attacker does armswing motion making sure they hit all 5 spots.  The speed is kept slow to accentuate that the player hits each one properly.
behaviors: Draw, palm open, elbow high, lead with hand, finish snapped

name: 1-5 fast
focus: Go through motion of the armswing accentuating key technical spots focusing on speeding the motion up.
description: Attacker does armswing motion attempting to hit all 5 spots and go quickly from 1 to 5.
behaviors: Draw, palm open, elbow high, lead with hand, finish snapped

name: 3-4 exchange
focus: Focus on the exchange from spot 3 to 4
description: Attacker just goes from spot 3 to 4 on armswing.  Leading with the hand.
behaviors: Start with hand, elbow high

name: 3-4-5 exchange
focus: Focus on the last three spots of the armswing.
description: Attacker starts in spot 3 then hits 4 and finishes with 5.
behaviors: Start with hand, elbow high, finish snapped

name: Tennis ball throws progression
focus: Focus on armswing using tennis balls

name: 3-4 Hold
focus: Focus on getting hand up.
description: Arms length away from the net, players start in 3 position of Armswing progression.  With just the motion from 3-4 player bounces tennis ball under the net.
behaviors: Snap and hold

focus: Focus on 3-4 exchange with a finish
description: Arms lengths away from net, players start in 3 position of Armswing progression.  Go from three to finish bouncing the ball under the net.
behaviors: Finish fast

name: 1-5 throw
focus: Do entire motion hitting all 5 spots
description: Arms length away form net, players do entire motion bouncing the ball under the net.
behaviors: Finish fast

name: Step Close to 4
focus: Work on step close footwork with armwing to spot 4.
description: Start with all of their weight 2nd step (of four step approach) inside 10', do the last two steps (step close) and throw tennis ball while stopping at spot four (top of armswing, wrist snapped)
behaviors: Weight on foot, step close, big arms, snap and hold

name: Step Close to 5
focus: Work on step close footwork with full armswing
description: Start with all of their weight 2nd step (of four step approach) inside 10', do the last two steps (step close) and throw tennis ball with full armswing focusing on the finish.
behaviors: Weight on foot, step close, big arms, focus on finish

name: Step Close to 5  (Finish Thumb Down)
focus: Work on step close footwork with full armswing with a focus on thumb down swing.
description: Start with all of their weight 2nd step (of four step approach) inside 10', do the last two steps (step close) and throw tennis ball with full armswing focusing on finishing with the thumb down.
behaviors: Weight on foot, step close, big arms, focus on finish thumb down

name: Step Close to 5 Line (Finish Thumb Up)
focus: Work on step close footwork with full armswing with a focus on thumb up swing.
description: Start with all of their weight 2nd step (of four step approach) inside 10', do the last two steps (step close) and throw tennis ball with full armswing focusing on finishing with the thumb up.
behaviors: Weight on foot, step close, big arms, focus on finish thumb up

name: Combination movement/throws
focus: Combining game movements with attacking motions and throws with tennis balls
description: Combine movements with an obstacle.

name: Step Close Throw Over Can
focus: Work on step close footwork with a full jump using an obstacle
description: Start with all of their weight 2nd step (of four step approach) inside 10', do the last two steps (step close) jump over garbage can and throw tennis ball with full armswing focusing on the finish.
behaviors: Hips down, arms up, jump through feet.

name: Full Approach and Throw Over Can
focus: Work on full step approach with a full jump using an obstacle
description: Start loaded, do a full approach, jump over can and throw.
behaviors: Hips down, arms up, jump through feet.

name: SR Pass to Full Approach and Throw
focus: Work on serve receive move and transition to full approach and jump using an obstacle
description: Start in a serve receive position (left or right).  Mimic a movement for a pass (work on all directions), transition to approach and jump over can and throw.
behaviors: Pass first, circle to approach

name: Defensive transition to Approach and Throw
focus: Work on transition base to defensive postion then to attack.
description: Start in base, execute a defensive move (left back), transition to attack, approach and jump over can and throw.
behaviors: Ready position, get past 10' line, double arm lift.

name: Weirding Lines
focus: Work on different armswings and contacts on ball.
description: Hitters attack the ball attempting to use different hand contacts.

name: Zone 2-3 Pin Quicks
focus: Work adapting offense and changing based on Zone pass.
description: Toss balls into Zone 2 or 3.  Hitter for that zone must change to a quick attack.
behaviors: See pass, call audible, be in the air

name: Back Row Options Off Digs
focus: Work on back row attacks in transition off a dig.
description: Hitter hits to a defender.  If ball goes to RB then libero will set the back row attacker, if not then setter will set back row.
behaviors: Dig high, load to approach, lead hitter

name: Defensive Transition to Back Row Attack
focus: Transitioning to a back row attack from a defensive position.
description: Back row players transition from base to a defensive position before attacking off a set.
behaviors: Get on step, lead the hitter

name: Defensive Play to Back Row Attack
focus: Transitioning to a back row attack after making a defensive play.
description: Back row players transition to attack after making a defensive play.
behaviors: Dig high, load to approach, lead hitter

name: Serve Receive with Back Row Attack
focus: Work on running back row attacks off served balls.
description: Server serves, receive passes ball, setter sets back row attack,  Use different patterns to work on different options.
behaviors: Shoot early, freeze, load to approach, lead hitter

name: Setter Transition to Back Row Attack
focus: Transitioning to attack out of the back row off a setter and out of system.
